channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Week: Trump Staffs Up
item.description: Plus: Pope Francis encourages the Saints.

item.title: Trump’s Foreign Policy Agenda Must Start By Undoing Four Years Of Global Insolvency
item.description: American resources are limited. We must address the greatest threats from large, powerful countries like China first, then everyone else.

item.title: Elon Musk blasts John Bolton as 'staggeringly dumb warmonger' after criticism of Trump AG pick Matt Gaetz
item.description: Elon Musk called John Bolton "a staggeringly dumb warmonger" and suggested that Bolton's opposition to someone is "a great sign!"

item.title: RFK Jr. and Our Big, Fat Controversies
item.description: I’m pretty sure that Kennedy is a crank, generally. But he’s not wrong when it comes to some basic arguments about food and nutrition in America.

item.title: Fetterman defends Casey-McCormick recount as challenger’s team says 'zero' path for Democrat
item.description: Pennsylvania Democratic Sen. John K. Fetterman talked to Fox News Digital about the Casey-McCormick race now headed for automatic recount.

item.title: The Senate Should Reject Matt Gaetz
item.description: He is a self-absorbed provocateur who has no relevant experience for such an important job.

item.title: Trump Should Revive His Pro-America 1776 Commission On Day One
item.description: Young Americans’ historical and civic illiteracy is a danger to the Republic, and it cannot be allowed to continue.

item.title: Meet Pete Hegseth: The 'recovering neocon' and Pentagon critic who's been tapped for Defense secretary
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump sent shock waves through the national security establishment when he nominated Pete Hegseth for Defense secretary.

item.title: Red One’s Instant Bamboozle
item.description: The Rock and Chris Evans peddle cynicism and surrogacy for Christmas.

item.title: America’s Adversaries Don’t Want Marco Rubio To Be The Next Secretary Of State
item.description: Rubio has proven himself as a hawk against America's most dangerous adversary: China.

item.title: Nixon Can Teach Trump About The Pitfalls Of Revenge Politics
item.description: The same types of angry diversions that consumed Democrats over the past eight years could easily undo Republican governance.

item.title: Will Democrats Now Become Born-Again Federalists?
item.description: Red-state arguments against federal-government overreach will now be dusted off in service of blue-state priorities. Good.
